Views Module

Django views for the Sticky Notes application.

This module contains view functions for creating, reading, updating, and deleting (CRUD) sticky notes.

stickynotes.views.sticky_note_create(request)[source]

Create a new sticky note.

Handles both GET (display form) and POST (process form) requests.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

On GET, renders form template. On successful POST,

redirects to the detail view of the newly created note.

Return type:

HttpResponse

stickynotes.views.sticky_note_delete(request, pk)[source]

Delete an existing sticky note.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • pk (int) – Primary key of the sticky note to delete.

Returns:

Redirects to the list view after successful deletion.

Return type:

HttpResponse

Raises:

Http404 – If the sticky note with the given pk does not exist.

stickynotes.views.sticky_note_detail(request, pk)[source]

Display details of a specific sticky note.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • pk (int) – Primary key of the sticky note to display.

Returns:

Rendered template with sticky note details.

Return type:

HttpResponse

Raises:

Http404 – If the sticky note with the given pk does not exist.

stickynotes.views.sticky_note_edit(request, pk)[source]

Edit an existing sticky note.

Handles both GET (display form) and POST (process form) requests.

Parameters:

  • request – The HTTP request object.

  • pk (int) – Primary key of the sticky note to edit.

Returns:

On GET, renders form template with current note data.

On successful POST, redirects to the detail view of the updated note.

Return type:

HttpResponse

Raises:

Http404 – If the sticky note with the given pk does not exist.

stickynotes.views.sticky_note_list(request)[source]

Display a list of all sticky notes.

Parameters:

request – The HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered template with list of all sticky notes.

Return type:

HttpResponse
